content.title: Women In Science and Engineering-Societal Challenges with Opportunities Fellowship
content.details: The 'Women In Science and Engineering-Societal Challenges with Opportunities (WISE-SCOPE) Fellowship' Program was started by the Department of Science & Technology, Government of India to provide opportunities to Women Scientists and Technologists who have completed Ph.D. and want to utilize their Science & Technology knowledge and expertise for the benefit of society. This program promotes projects that directly deal with challenges at the grassroots level and address them through Science & Technology interventions. Projects under WISE-SCOPE should provide Science & Technology solutions to social problems, livelihood generation, drudgery reduction, health and nutrition-related issues, management of natural resources, sustainable agriculture, climate change, disaster management, etc.
benefits: Fellowship amount of ₹55,000/- and HRA (as per norms) per month.
Research Grant of ₹2.00 Lakhs per year.
Field Demonstration of ₹1.00 Lakh (for project tenure).
Cost of small equipment (up to a maximum of ₹2.00 Lakhs) along with Institutional overhead charges as per DST norms.
eligibility: Candidates in regular employment are not eligible for WISE-SCOPE.
Women Scientists who have completed a Ph.D. in Basic or Applied Sciences or have equivalent degrees like MD/MS/MDS are eligible.
Minimum age to apply is 27 years and maximum is 60 years as of the date of submission.
exclusions: Candidates in regular employment are not eligible for WISE-SCOPE.
content.application_process: Online application process through ePMS portal.
documents_required: Endorsement from the Head of the Institute

faqs.question: What is the aim of this program?
faqs.answer: The aim of the program is to provide opportunities to Women Scientists and Technologists who have completed Ph.D. and want to utilize their Science & Technology knowledge and expertise for the benefit of society.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing department of this program?
faqs.answer: Department of Science & Technology, Government of India.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the Fellowship?
faqs.answer: Women Scientists who have completed a Ph.D. in Basic or Applied Sciences or have equivalent degrees like MD/MS/MDS are eligible for the WISE-SCOPE fellowship.

faqs.question: What are the thematic areas covered under this Fellowship?
faqs.answer: Energy, Water and Waste Management (EWWM), Engineering and Technology Development (ETD), Environment, Climate and Sustainable Development (ECSD), Agriculture and Allied Sciences (AAS), Health, Food, and Nutrition (HFN).

faqs.question: What is the nature of support for the Fellow?
faqs.answer: Fellowship amount of ₹55,000/- and HRA (as per norms) per month, Research Grant of ₹2.00 Lakhs per year, Field Demonstration of ₹1.00 Lakh (for project tenure), and cost of small equipment (up to a maximum of ₹2.00 Lakhs) along with Institutional overhead charges as per DST norms.

faqs.question: What is the age criterion to apply under the program?
faqs.answer: The minimum age to apply is 27 years and the maximum is 60 years as of the date of submission.

faqs.question: Can a candidate having regular employment apply under the program?
faqs.answer: No, the candidates in regular employment are not eligible for WISE-SCOPE fellowship.

faqs.question: What shall be the tenure of the project?
faqs.answer: The project tenure shall be up to 3 years.

faqs.question: Can a woman scientist who is temporarily employed apply to this program?
faqs.answer: Yes, the women scientists who are temporarily employed in research or academics may apply to this program but they have to leave earlier assignments, if selected for the WISE-SCOPE program.

faqs.question: What is the last date for receipt of Application?
faqs.answer: The online Application portal is open throughout the year for proposal submission.

faqs.question: How to apply under the program?
faqs.answer: The call is open for proposal submission under WISE-SCOPE at ePMS.
